intro: Crantzia hirtella, commonly known as hairy crantzia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. It produces small, pale yellow to white composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Crantzia hirtella is often found in open, disturbed areas and is adapted to arid environments.
